newsitem.title: LATVIA: NOMURA OFFERS TO LEAD UNIBANKA SHARE, BOND ISSUE.
newsitem.headline: NOMURA OFFERS TO LEAD UNIBANKA SHARE, BOND ISSUE.

text.p: International investment bank Nomura said on Tuesday that it has offered to arrange a planned issue of Unibanka shares and bonds.
"We are discussing but no final decision has been made," Nomura corporate finance official Claus Mansfeldt told Reuters.

The share issue will take place as the government has decided to sell 23 percent of its 33 percent stake in Unibanka. The seller of the stake will be the privatisation agency, which holds the Unibanka shares on behalf of the government.
Mansfeldt said that his bank had offered to issue the Unibanka shares in a mix of global depository receipts (GDR) and ordinary, lat-denominated shares.
"The majority will be dedicated to the GDR issue," Mansfeldt told Reuters.
But he said Nomura has proposed an open issue so that either the GDR or the domestic tranche can be increased or decreased according to demand for each portion of the share offer.
"The issue could easily be $20 million to $30 million," Mansfeldt added.
He also said that Nomura has offered to lead an issue of Unibanka bonds, which will probably have a maturity of three to five years and be worth some $50 million.
He said that Unibanka should try and get a credit rating in the process of arranging the bond issue.
